intro: Hieracium incisum subsp. pseudeversianum, commonly known as the false everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is a perennial species that produces small, wind-dispersed seeds.
